casebody.data:
UNITED STATES of America ex rel. John RESTIVO, Relator-Appellant, v. Benjamin M. DAY, Commissioner of Immigration at the Port of New York, Respondent-Appellee. No. 320. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. May 5, 1930. Gaspare M. Cusumano, of New York City, for appellant. Charles H. Tuttle, U. S. Atty., of New York City (Leon E. Spencer, of New York City, of counsel.), for appellee.

Before MANTON, L. HAND, and CHASE, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Order affirmed.
